node.statement: (Assembly: T_psi*mu << mu with R = exp(Psi^{ren})/Z) Combining nodes 1.6.4.1 through 1.6.4.4: For any bounded continuous G on C^{-1/2-delta}(T^3): E_{T_psi*mu}[G] = lim E_P[G(Phi_eps + psi)] (by bounded convergence on the Skorokhod space, since Phi_eps -> Phi a.s. and G(. + psi) is continuous and bounded) = lim E_P[G(Phi_eps) Y_eps W_eps] / E_P[Y_eps W_eps] (by the Boltzmann ratio identity, node 1.6.4.2) = E_rho[G] (by the tilted-measure Vitali convergence, node 1.6.4.4) = (1/Z) E_mu[G exp(Psi^{ren})] (by definition of rho, node 1.6.4.1). Since this holds for all bounded continuous G, and C^{-1/2-delta}(T^3) is a Polish space, we conclude T_psi*mu = rho as probability measures (portmanteau theorem / uniqueness of probability measures determined by C_b). In particular: (i) T_psi*mu << mu (since rho << mu by construction). (ii) d(T_psi*mu)/dmu = R := exp(Psi^{ren})/Z, with R > 0 mu-a.s. (node 1.6.4.1(c)). (iii) E_mu[R] = 1 (node 1.6.4.1(b)). (iv) The identity extends from bounded continuous G to all bounded measurable G by the standard monotone class argument: the class of bounded measurable G satisfying E_{T_psi*mu}[G] = E_mu[G R] contains C_b, is closed under bounded pointwise limits, and hence contains all bounded Borel functions. CONCLUSION: T_psi*mu << mu and d(T_psi*mu)/dmu(phi) = exp(Psi^{ren}(phi)) / Z. DEPENDENCIES: 1.6.4.1, 1.6.4.2, 1.6.4.3, 1.6.4.4, 1.6.3.2, 1.6.3.3, 1.6.3.8.
